Class WalkingActor

java.lang.Object
greenfoot.Actor
SuperSmoothMover
WalkingActor
public abstract class WalkingActor extends SuperSmoothMover
WalkingActor is a shared superclass for Player and Enemy. In this class: - Direction constants (UP/DOWN/LEFT/RIGHT) - Directional frame arrays (up/down/left/right) - Sprite loading and scaling - Animation ticking - Avoid Walking through walls

    • resetAnim

      protected void resetAnim()
      Resets the animation back to the first frame and restarts the animation timer

    • loadDirectionalFrames

      protected void loadDirectionalFrames(String folder, int frameCount)
      Loads 2-direction frames from a folder like: images/player/up1.png up2.png ... etc file must be in png

    • loadFramesRequired

      protected greenfoot.GreenfootImage[] loadFramesRequired(String prefix, int count)
      Loads a fixed set of animation frames that are expected to exist. - load the image - scale it if needed - if the file is missing, return a placeholder image
      Parameters:
      prefix - the beginning of the filename (e.g. plaer/up )
      count - how many frames to load
      Returns:
      an array of frames in order (index 0 holds frame 1)

    • safeLoadAndScale

      protected greenfoot.GreenfootImage safeLoadAndScale(String path)
      Loads an image from the given file path and scale it If the image cannot be loaded this method returns a placeholder image instead of returning null to prevent crashing the game. The placeholder: - has size (spriteW x spriteH) - is filled with magenta (easy to notice) - has the text "MISSING" drawn on it
      Parameters:
      path - the image file path/name to load
      Returns:
      the loaded/scaled image if it exists; otherwise a placeholder image

    • placeHolderImage

      protected greenfoot.GreenfootImage placeHolderImage()
      Creates and returns a placeholder image used when a sprite file is missing. The placeholder is: - the same size as a normal sprite (spriteW by spriteH) - filled with a bright magenta color so it stands out - labeled with the text "MISSING" in black
      Returns:
      a placeholder GreenfootImage

    • framesFor

      protected greenfoot.GreenfootImage[] framesFor(int direction)
      Returns the animation frame array that matches the given direction.
      Parameters:
      direction - the direction the actor is facing (UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT)
      Returns:
      the frame array for that direction (up, down, left, or right)

    • animate

      protected void animate()
      Updatethe animation for the actor's current facing direction.

    • animate

      protected void animate(greenfoot.GreenfootImage[] frames)
      Updates the animation using the given frames array.
      Parameters:
      frames - the animation frames to aniamate

    • avoidWallMoving

      protected void avoidWallMoving(int dx, int dy)
      Moves while preventing going through Blocker objects. Move X first then Y Always move in straight line

    • mirrorImage

      protected greenfoot.GreenfootImage[] mirrorImage(greenfoot.GreenfootImage[] original)
      Creates mirrored images Call this original is loaded and scaled
